}} 'Sean John Combs' (born November 4, 1969), also known by his stage names
'Puff Daddy', 'Diddy', and 'P. Diddy', is an American rapper, record producer,
actor, and entrepreneur. Combs was born in Harlem and grew up in Mount Vernon,
New York. He worked as a talent director at Uptown Records before founding Bad
Boy Records in 1993. He signed The Notorious B.I.G. and profited from the
success of the artists he signed. He released his debut album [[No Way Out
(album)|No Way Out]] in 1997, which has been certified seven times platinum and
was followed by successful albums such as [[Forever (Puff Daddy album)|Forever]]
(1999), [[The Saga Continues...]] (2001) and [[Press Play (album)|Press Play]]
(2006). In 2009 Combs formed the musical group Diddy â Dirty Money and
released the critically well-reviewed and commercially successful album [[Last
Train to Paris]] (2009).

Combs has won three Grammy Awards and two MTV Video Music Awards, and is the
producer of MTV's [[Making the Band]]. His non-music business ventures include
the clothing lines Sean John and "Sean by Sean Combs" â for which he earned
a Council of Fashion Designers of America award â a movie production
company, and two restaurants. In 2012 [[Forbes]] estimated Combs' net worth at
$550 million, making him the richest figure in hip hop.
categories: Participants in American reality television series
